intro: Gaura exaltata, commonly known as whorled gaura, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Polemoniaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and clusters of delicate, pink or white flowers. The plant thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for garden landscapes. Its foliage is often covered in fine, hairy hairs, which help reduce water loss in arid conditions. Gaura exaltata is known for its long blooming period, typically from late spring to early autumn.
